com.dautelle.realtime
Class ObjectPool

java.lang.Object
  com.dautelle.realtime.ObjectPool
public abstract class ObjectPool
extends java.lang.Object

This abstract class represents an object pool managed by a PoolContext. Instance of this class do not require synchronization, if the pool is current then the pool is safe to be used by the current thread.

Version:
6.0, Jan 18, 2004
Author:
Jean-Marie Dautelle

          Base constructor.

          Removes all objects from this pool, after disposal this pool allocates object on the heap exclusively (and this.isHeap() should always returns true).

Constructor Detail

ObjectPool

protected ObjectPool(ObjectFactory factory)
Base constructor.

Parameters:
factory - the factory constructing the objects of this pool.
Method Detail

getFactory

public final ObjectFactory getFactory()
Returns the factory constructing the objects of this pool.

Returns:
the factory constructing the objects of this pool.

isCurrent

public final boolean isCurrent()
Indicates if this pool is the current pool for the current thread.

Returns:
true if this thread is currently using this pool; false otherwise.

getOuter

public final ObjectPool getOuter()
Returns the outer pool of this pool.

Returns:
the outer pool or null if this pool represents the heap.

isHeap

public final boolean isHeap()
Indicates if this pool allocates on the heap. A pool which has been disposed always allocate on the heap.

Returns:
true if this pool represents the heap; false otherwise.

next

public abstract java.lang.Object next()
Returns the next available object from this pool. If there is none, a new object is allocated on the heap, added to the pool and returned.

Returns:
the next available object from this pool.

recycle

public abstract void recycle(java.lang.Object obj)
Recycles the specified object. This method has no effect if this pool is the heap. Callers should make sure that the recycled object is not going to be referenced anymore (in a heap context it would be garbage collected).

Parameters:
obj - the object to recycle to this pool.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the specified object do not belong to the pool.

export

public abstract void export(java.lang.Object obj)
Exports the specified object out of this pool to the outer pool. To avoid pool depletion it is usually recommended to swap the specified object with a free object from the outer pool.

Parameters:
obj - the object to export to outer pool.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the specified object do not belong to the pool.

remove

public abstract void remove(java.lang.Object obj)
Removes the specified object from this pool. After removal the specified object belongs to the heap and will be garbage collected if not referenced. To avoid pool depletion it is usually recommended to add a new object allocated on the heap to the pool.

Parameters:
obj - the object to remove from this pool.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the specified object do not belong to the pool.

recycleAll

protected abstract void recycleAll()
Recycles all the objects of this pool.

Note: This method is called upon exit of a pool context for which this pool has been used.

dispose

protected abstract void dispose()
Removes all objects from this pool, after disposal this pool allocates object on the heap exclusively (and this.isHeap() should always returns true).

Note: This method is called upon clearing of the pool context this pool belongs to.
